skill.name: global-commenting
skill.description: Write minimal, evergreen code comments that explain complex logic without documenting obvious behavior or temporary changes. Use this skill when adding comments to PHP files, TypeScript/JavaScript files, or any code files, when documenting complex algorithms or business logic, when adding PHPDoc blocks or JSDoc comments, when writing self-documenting code with clear naming, or when reviewing existing comments for relevance and necessity. Focus on keeping code self-explanatory through clear structure and naming rather than relying heavily on comments.

content.user_title: Write better code comments with AI guidance
content.value_statement: Code comments often become outdated or state the obvious. This skill helps you write meaningful, evergreen comments that explain complex logic and reduce maintenance burden.
actual_capabilities: Provides guidance on writing minimal, meaningful comments
Helps document complex business logic and algorithms
Assists with PHPDoc and JSDoc comment formatting
Reviews existing comments for relevance and necessity
Promotes self-documenting code through clear naming
limitations: Does not automatically generate comments for you
Requires human judgment for what needs documentation
Cannot analyze code complexity to suggest comments
Limited to guidance on comment style and best practices

use_cases.title: Write better PHPDoc comments
use_cases.description: Get guidance on documenting PHP classes, methods, and complex array shapes with proper PHPDoc syntax

use_cases.title: Improve JSDoc documentation
use_cases.description: Learn when and how to write meaningful JSDoc comments for functions and complex logic

use_cases.title: Review comment quality
use_cases.description: Evaluate existing comments for relevance, accuracy, and whether they should be refactored into clearer code

prompt_templates.title: Document complex algorithm
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a complex sorting algorithm
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a comment for this sorting function that explains why we are using this specific algorithm instead of the built-in sort

prompt_templates.title: Add PHPDoc to class
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new PHP service class
prompt_templates.prompt: Write PHPDoc comments for this service class including the purpose, main responsibilities, and any important implementation details

prompt_templates.title: Review comment necessity
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these comments and suggest which ones can be removed by improving the code clarity instead

prompt_templates.title: Document business rule
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a comment that explains this business rule and why it is implemented this way

output_examples.input: Help me comment this complex date calculation function
output: Consider adding: 'Calculates the next business day, accounting for weekends and holidays'
Explain the algorithm: 'Uses a while loop to skip weekends and checks against a holiday array'
Document edge cases: 'Returns the same day if it is already a business day before cutoff time'
Identify obvious comments that can be removed by renaming variables
Suggest comments for complex validation logic
Flag comments that may become outdated when business rules change

output_examples.input: Add documentation to my utility library
output: Create JSDoc headers for exported functions with parameter types
Add examples in docstrings for complex functions
Document side effects and return value expectations clearly

best_practices: Write comments that explain why not what - the code already shows what it does
Keep comments evergreen by avoiding references to temporary fixes or recent changes
Prefer refactoring code for clarity over adding explanatory comments
anti_patterns: Do not write obvious comments like increment counter - the code is already clear
Avoid commenting out code instead of deleting it - use version control for history
Do not use comments as an excuse for writing unclear code - fix the code first

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all programming languages?
faq.answer: The principles apply universally, but examples focus on PHP, TypeScript, and JavaScript as used in Laravel projects.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically generate comments for my code?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance and best practices. You still need to write the comments yourself based on the advice given.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing documentation tools?
faq.answer: It complements tools like PHPDoc and JSDoc by helping you write better content for your documentation blocks.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external services when using this skill?
faq.answer: No, this is a local skill that provides guidance. No code is transmitted to external services.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the commenting advice provided?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidelines, not rules. Use your judgment based on your team standards and project needs.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This focuses on the quality and necessity of comments rather than just formatting, helping you write meaningful documentation.
